Legal_Issue: Credibility findings, sur place refugee claim
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's evidence found implausible regarding relationship, escape, and medical treatment
Evidence_Type: Personal testimony, medical records, relationship details
Basis_of_Claim: Persecution due to homosexuality and alleged sur place activism in Canada
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credible evidence supporting relationship, escape, medical treatment, and insufficient proof of activism risking persecution
Application_Error: Failure to establish credibility; failure to substantiate sur place claim
Legal_Standard: Plausibility, consistency, and coherence of testimony
Application_Factor: Emergence of sur place claim from evidence
Decision_Review_Issue: Did the Board err in credibility assessment and fail to consider sur place claim?
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 97(1) IRPA; case law on sur place claims and credibility
Cause_of_Refusal: Implausible evidence and lack of sufficient evidence for sur place claim
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 97(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in personal narrative, lack of corroboration
Procedural_Fairness: Board considered all perceptible issues including implied sur place elements
Credibility_Issues: Doubts about authenticity of relationship, escape story, and medical treatment
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Allegation of Board error in credibility and sur place analysis
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (implied)
Procedural_Issue: Failure to raise sur place claim explicitly but assessed nonetheless
Omission_Type: Failure to provide sufficient evidence for emerging sur place claim
